article:
This 'list of grape varieties' includes cultivated grapes, whether used for
wine, or eating as a table grape, fresh or dried (raisin, currant, sultana).

The term grape variety actually refers to cultivars rather than botanical
varieties according to the International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated
Plants, because they are propagated by cuttings and may have unstable
reproductive properties. However, the term variety has become so entrenched in
viticulture that any change to usage of the term cultivar is unlikely.
